## toggle() function

Stateful transducer which accepts any input and flips between given `on` / `off` values for every value received. The `initial` state can be optionally provided (default: false) and must be given if used as an iterator.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function toggle<T>(on: T, off: T, initial?: boolean): Transducer<any, T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  on | <code>T</code> | result for "on" state |
|  off | <code>T</code> | result for "off" state |
|  initial | <code>boolean</code> | initial state |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Transducer<any, T>`

## Example


```ts
[...toggle(1, 0, false, [1, 2, 3, 4])]
// [ 1, 0, 1, 0 ]

[...tx.toggle("on", "off", true, [1, 2, 3, 4])]
// [ 'off', 'on', 'off', 'on' ]

```
